result.execSummary:
The defendant Anna M Reilly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Consecutive to:

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Any valid prescriptions drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on September 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anna M Reilly in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Williams Buttery moves to schedule these matters for a PLEAS hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anna M Reilly in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is seeking a global resolution in these matters.  Hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness and co defendants listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Anna M Reilly in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Capias not to issue.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Nicole Williams Buttery in court.   Defendant Anna M Reilly did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant mixed up the court dates and did not appear today. Court issues capias but stays to June 29, 2015 at 8:15 am  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Initial appearance on June 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.
